Talk29:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>If I had that picture, the sculpture would
be son and done. But...I can't force you.
Talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>It's an honor to see your face with my
eyeballs once again, and on such a 
pretty-pretty day no less.
Talk47:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>My lips do curl into a grin at the honor
of bumping into you again. And on such
a handsome night too!
Talk64:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>Waaafafare! You shouldn't have moved
my sculpture there! Quickly, please,
put it back!
Talk48:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>To cross your path again! An honor!
A pleasure!<sp:5:1:0> And I see you're moisturizing
your face skin. Hydration is so important.
Talk65:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM>Oh boo! Your pouch is stuffed full!


I've got monster extract to give you, but
first you'll have to make room to carry it.
Talk49:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal>The truth is—and this is just between
you and me—I have adored monsters
ever since I was a wee Kilton.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Oh, uh...


How strange.<sp:5:1:0> This is usually the part
where you say...

<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>"Whaaat?! <sp:5:0:0>Monsters?! <sp:5:0:0>Disgusting!"


<sp:3:0:2:0701>But here you are...so sensitive to
my sensitivities.

I know, I know... Monsters are violent
creatures and despised the world over
because of it. That I can't deny.
<sp:3:0:2:0900>But they're also misunderstood!<sp:5:0:0> The way
everyone hates them without even trying
to understand them... Pitiful! Tragic!
And so I will educate the world
about monsters...

And once the world understands
monsters, they will love monsters.
That is my dream!
But for my plan to succeed, I require
the assistance of the finest carpenter in
all the land... Hudson!
Talk66:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM>Hooyagee?! <sp:5:0:0>I was going to give you a
token of my thanks, but your pouch is
full up.
Make some room in there and I'll give
you the monster extract that's waiting
for you.
Talk68:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Hrm...if I remember rightly, Robbie at
<clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>...

Yes, Robbie has <clr:0000>a tool of some sort that
can paint a detailed picture<clr:ffff>, and quickly
too. Or so I hear.
If you had that tool, I bet you could paint
pictures of monsters with it.
Talk69: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting>Wind or rain,<sp:5:0:0> I can still explain!
Talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Great, just leave it to me. I'll get it
made, son and done!
0006: I found a nice spot for it.
Talk30:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Yes, now we must show it to every eyeball
in the village.
Talk14:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800>Ha-hiyoo!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


Look at this! It is the very monster
sculpture I've been longing for!
Talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Hear ye, hear ye! Come, look see!


I present to you the famed Bokoblin!


Do not fear, draw near! This is the
only place you can safely admire such
a creature up close. The only place!
Talk32:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aww! When you look at it like this, it is
rather cute.
Talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Now, prettiest please, would you pick
the perfect spot to display this sculpture
on the <clr:0000>stage <clr:ffff>over yonder?
Talk33:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ahem. This sight has stolen your eyes.
Now, give me your ears! All of them!

Without further ado, this adorable,
cuddle-able monster is called a
Bokoblin.
They make house and home throughout
Hyrule and are, perhaps, the monster
you've rubbed shoulder bones with most.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>With their large, fwoopy ears and cute,
gloofy snouties, one can't help but want
to give them a tight squeeze.
Sadly, their social skills are quite...
stunted...and it's best to look elsewhere
for a friendly embrace.
Talk44_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My little brother, <clr:0000>Koltin<clr:ffff>, is faring well,
thanks to you.<sp:0:4:0>Look, over there...
Talk50:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ah, yes.<sp:5:0:0> If you want,<sp:5:0:0> I will tell my story
as many times as your ears will hear it.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>You see, I've loved monsters ever since
I was a wee Kilton.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Needless to say, I've been mocked and
ridiculed more times than I can count for
these tenderest feelings of mine.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Of course, monsters are violent creatures
and despised for this bad behavior.
I comprehend! I do!
<sp:3:0:2:0900>But they are also misunderstood!<sp:5:0:0> And
I can't think of a sadder fate than to be
hated because you're not understood.
That's why I want to teach everyone—
EVERYONE—about monsters!

If all could comprehend these creatures,
I'm sure they could also love them.
At least...that is my dream.
But if I'm to pull this fantasy from my skull
and make it real in the world... I'll need
the finest carpenter there is. Hudson!
Talk34:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Goodness, yes, I do feel like giving it
a hug all of a sudden.
Talk44_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Ease_01>Hm, he isn't there now...<sp:5:0:0> but <clr:0000>when the
sun goes down<clr:ffff>, you'll find his <clr:0000>charming<clr:ffff>,
<clr:0000>multicolored <clr:ffff>stall upon that hill.
He's working so very hard to make his
dream come true.<sp:5:0:0> You should speak
with him if you see him.
Talk51:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My younger brother, <clr:0000>Koltin<clr:ffff>, is faring well,
thanks to you.<sp:0:4:0>Ah, look see! There he is now!
Talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Look and learn! Then you won't hate!
Understand what you fear and you'll
feel great!
For those with an open mind, wonders
always await!
Talk52:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You met again with my younger brother,
<clr:0000>Koltin<clr:ffff>, didn't you!<sp:5:0:0> I can smell it!

He is a bit...eccentric...I know, I know!
But I hope you'll find it inside your heart
to treat him with kindness.
Talk70:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's not that I mind working in the
rain, it's just...
Talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've got a rule against making that kind
of decision. Too much responsibility.
Not my thing.
Talk53:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Heehee-hoohoo! As soon as <clr:0000>Hudson<clr:ffff> is
done with his other business, you must
come back!
I promise you a monstrous spectacle
the likes of which no one has seen before!
Talk54:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Ah, where are my manners? I have yet to
greet you properly.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Kilton, at your service!


Once upon a time, I made goods from
monster parts, you see, and traveled
about selling them from my shop.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But once I had saved up a tidy little
nest omelet, I gave that stall to my
younger brother.
Now I've purchased this plot of dirt land
so that I can, at last, make real a <clr:0000>dream<clr:ffff>
I've dreamed since I was a wee Kilton.
Talk55:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I am exactly as I was. <sp:5:1:0>I continue to
eagerly await assistance from the
president of <clr:0000>Hudson Construction<clr:ffff>.
He appears to be busy with something...
important...I'm sure.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Still! It's only a matter of time before my
<clr:0000>dream<clr:ffff> is not just a thing stuck inside my
skull but a thing here in the world instead.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Eee! I am aquiver with excitement at the
thought of it!
Talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>*sigh* <sp:5:1:0>If only I had a <clr:0000>detailed picture<clr:ffff>
of a Bokoblin...
Talk56:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>When the sun goes down and my younger
brother's <clr:0000>charming stall<clr:ffff> appears...

it's as if <clr:0000>Koltin's<clr:ffff> hard work and big
dreams float before my very eyes. How
it makes a grin curl right up to my ears!
My big <clr:0000>dream <clr:ffff>will soon be a reality too!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>Ahh, even as I wait for Mr. Hudson to
make himself available, I quiver with
excitement at what's to come!
Near03: I don't mind the rain, but...
Talk57:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's his <clr:0000>charming stall<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0> I'm certain he's
in there now, working hard to make his
dream come true.
Talk58:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It gives me great relief to see my younger
brother, <clr:0000>Koltin<clr:ffff>, doing well today.
Talk59:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That <clr:0000>charming stall<clr:ffff>... How my heart
inflates with joy to see my old place
help my little brother chase his dream.
Talk76:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Why <sp:5:0:0>hello to you!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0>What a coincidence it is to see you in a
place like this! <sp:5:1:0>Thank you for your help
with my little brother the other day...
Talk77:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, where are my manners. I have yet
to greet you properly.<sp:5:1:0> My name, again,
is Kilton.
Once upon a time, I made goods from
monster parts, you see, and traveled
all about selling them from my shop.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But I gave my stall to my younger brother
and have come to this village to make real
a <clr:0000>dream<clr:ffff> I've dreamed for so long!
In fact, at this very moment, <sp:5:1:0>I am
discussing with President Hudson
that very dream.
Talk78:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Kilton asked me to make a <clr:0000>monster
sculpture<clr:ffff>... <sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0501>But, uh, I'm not sure what, exactly,
he wants this "<clr:0000>monster sculpture<clr:ffff>" 
to look like.
Talk79:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Aah, it's you. <sp:5:1:0>So you know Kilton,
do you?
Talk00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What I'm trying to say is...


A <clr:0000>Bokoblin<clr:ffff>'s most distinguishing feature
is its nose, which you'll find squished
upon its face like...GLOOF!
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Its ears, on the other hand, are quite
FWOOPY, and its horn goes ZWIIIFF!
Talk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm. That description of yours... Can't
say I get the picture.
Talk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I want to try my hand at making this
sculpture. I just...don't get what it's
supposed to look like.
Talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>We went to all that trouble to get this
monster sculpture sculpted...

I want nothing more than to give it the
many looking eyeballs it deserves.
Talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Awww...<sp:5:0:0>but...but...who will arrange it
on the stage for me?
Talk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Sorry, sorry! I am an awful describer
of things.

I would draw you a <clr:0000>detailed picture<clr:ffff> of a
Bokoblin if I could. But there is no art to
be found in the bones of my body.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But fret not! I, Kilton, will describe the
monster to you with more enthusiasm
and much zest. Surely that will help!
Talk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Eh, well, <sp:5:0:0>it would be better if I had a
<clr:0000>detailed picture <clr:ffff>to refer to.<sp:5:1:0>
Talk23:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800>Ooh! OOOOOOH!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


Such artistry! It's everything I ever
hoped it would be!

And so realistic too! It's as if my nose
holes might catch a whiff of monster
scent at any moment!
Talk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm. I'm trying to understand but I can't
quite see it.

Without a <clr:0000>detailed picture<clr:ffff> of this <clr:0000>Bokoblin<clr:ffff>
thing, I don't know what I can do.
Talk24:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It's true! Even I could mistake that
sculpture for a living, breathing
monster!
Talk41:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Sadly, it seems the president of <clr:0000>Hudson
Construction <clr:ffff>is very busy...and I can't
take my next step forward without him.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Still! It's only a matter of time before my
<clr:0000>dream<clr:ffff> is not a thing stuck inside my skull,
but a thing here in the world instead!
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Eee! I am aquiver with excitement at the
thought of it!
Talk08:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00>Dya... <sp:5:1:0>Dyaaaaaah!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>


Th-that's it exactly! That's the Bokoblin
I'm looking for!
Talk25:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you! <sp:5:0:0>And thank you once more!


You've not only helped my younger
brother but me too!

Please, take this as a token of my
thankfulness. <sp:5:0:0>It's a concoction of my
own making, you might say.
Talk43:
This is Kilton. He moved in to Tarrey Town
the other day.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>He asked me to make a <clr:0000>sculpture of a
monster <clr:ffff>for him.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ah, now this is a good picture! Let me
use it for reference, and I can make the
sculpture, no problem.
Talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>You are a great artist, worthy of renown.
And because of you, I've taken the first
step toward making my dream come true!
I have long desired to collect sculptures
of monsters from around the world and
display them for all the eyeballs to see.
I hope this will help shine a light on
these magnificent creatures and the
many wonderful ways about them.
Talk60:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My younger brother, <clr:0000>Koltin<clr:ffff>...how was he?<sp:0:4:0>He is a bit...eccentric. I know, I know!
But I hope you'll find it inside your heart
to treat him with kindness.
Talk27:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>A magnificent picture-painting indeed!
And yes, this is a monster to be sure!

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But...<sp:5:0:0>it's not a Bokoblin.


Bokoblins' ears are more, how do I say...<sp:5:0:0>
FWOOPY...<sp:5:0:0>and their horns are sure to go
ZWIIIFF!
Talk61:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>My own <clr:0000>dream <clr:ffff>will soon begin its journey
toward reality too!

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ahh, even as I wait for Mr. Hudson to
make himself available, I quiver with
excitement at what's to come!
Talk62:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>This monster sculpture is precious to
me. It belongs here! Please. Don't take
it away.
